arm_group.description: Experimental:   fiberoptic bronchoscope fiberoptic bronchoscope is used to facilitate for nasotracheal intubation.
Experimental:   video-stylet video-stylet is used to facilitate for nasotracheal intubation.

brief_summary.textblock:
The aim of the study is to investigate the efficiency of the Video-stylet (Trachway ®) and
      the fiberoptic bronchoscopy in facilitation of nasotracheal intubation in limited mouth
      opening patients.

clinical_study.brief_title: Video-stylet for Nasotracheal Intubation in Limited Mouth Opening Patient

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. patients with American Society of Anesthesiologists physical status I-III

          2. aged 20-65 years

          3. Requiring Nasotracheal Intubation under general anesthesia

          4. limited mouth open ,mouth open ＜ 3 cm

          5. unlimited neck motion

        Exclusion Criteria:

          1. Ankylosing arthritis patients.

          2. BMI≧35 kg/m2

facility.name: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Nasotracheal Intubation Assisted by a Video-stylet in Limited Mouth Opening Patient

other_outcome.description: Events of intubating related nasal bleeding are recorded on selected nostril and oral cavity at 3 minutes post-intubation and post-operatively. Incidences of sore throat and hoarseness are evaluated before patients out of recovery room and the following morning
other_outcome.measure: perioperative epistaxis, sore throat and hoarseness

primary_outcome.description:
Nasotracheal intubation is assisted by a video-stylet may be performed in patients undergoing Limited Mouth Opening following induction of anesthesia (fentanyl 2 micro-gram/kg, thiamylal 5 mg/kg) and is facilitated by cis-atracurium 0.2 mg/kg administration. propofol 1 mg/kg intravenously to blunt hemodynamic responses while intubation.
a modified intubation difficulty scale to evaluate the difficulty of fiber-scope guided or trachway assisted nasotracheal intubation
primary_outcome.measure: number of the patients with successful nasotracheal intubation and scoring modified  intubation difficulty scale

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: time of Intubating the nasotracheal tube (NT) from selected nostril to trachea is continuously calculated but separately into two parts. part one: from leaving off mask ventilation (mask removal from face), to the NT tip on the nasopharynx. part two: advancing NT from nasopharynx, through vocal cord into trachea, to present of 3 end tidal carbon dioxide waveforms.

clinical_study.source: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

lead_sponsor.agency: Kaohsiung Medical University Chung-Ho Memorial Hospital

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
